In Syria, the return of exiles: 'I've been waiting for this moment for 14 years'
subhed: 'Syria after Assad' (2/4). Since the fall of Bashar al-Assad's dictatorial regime one year ago, more than 1.2 million exiled Syrians have returned home. The journey back has often been extremely difficult, but it is driven by a determination to rebuild their lives in their homeland.

subhed: Despite a decline in exports to the US, China continues to flood other regions with its products.

title: Luigi Mangione's to-do list revealed in court: 'Pluck eyebrows ... keep momentum, FBI slower overnight'
subhed: The notes found during the 27-year-old's arrest at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, shown on Monday at a pretrial hearing in NYC, included a hand-drawn map and survival tactics. Mangione has pleaded not guilty to state and federal murder charges for the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson last December.

title: OpenAI names Slack CEO Denise Dresser as its first chief of revenue
subhed: Dresser, who has spent 14 years at Salesforce, will oversee global revenue strategy and 'help more businesses put AI to work in their day-to-day operations,' the ChatGPT maker said on Tuesday, signaling its seriousness about profitability.

title: President Nicusor Dan: 'In Romania, we do not have a real policy to defend against disinformation'
byline: Interview by Jean-Baptiste Chastand (Bucharest (Romania) special correspondent) and Marine Leduc
subhed: Romania borders Ukraine and is at the front line against Russian interference, which led to the cancellation of the presidential election a year ago. In an interview with Le Monde, President Nicusor Dan, elected in May, revisits the matter and discusses the differences between Europe and the US regarding the war in Ukraine.

The incomplete transformation of Syria's Ahmed al-Sharaa, Islamist rebel turned president
subhed: 'Syria after Assad' (1/4). The man who toppled Syria's Baathist regime has succeeded in breaking the country's international isolation. Yet the former jihadist, who governs with a handful of loyal followers, has struggled to defuse the sectarian and ethnic tensions left by the civil war.

title: France's budget, a crucial task in mostly male hands
subhed: The two finance committees are the most male-dominated in the entire French Parliament. Neither has ever been chaired by a woman.

title: Syria's last embroiderers: 'I lost my home and my fields, but I always kept this bag'
subhed: A symbol of the country's diversity, Syrian embroidery nearly disappeared during the 13 years of civil war. Since the fall of Bashar al-Assad in late 2024, a group of women led by a German woman in her 70s has been trying to keep this age-old art alive.
